p: After 24 h, the reactions were scavenged, evaporated, dissolved in DMSO and screened in duplicate at a total product concentration of 20 μM using an established fluorescence anisotropy (FA) assay (Figure 5a, left). Significant bioactivity was identified in the products of reactions with the diazo substrates F2, F3 and F4. In the case of F3, activity was observed for reactions with or without a co‐substrate, suggesting that F3 alone might yield bioactive product(s); the Rh 2piv 4‐catalysed reaction of F3 was shown to yield both 16 and 17 (Figure 5b, left). LC/MS of three hit reactions involving F2 and F4 confirmed the formation of intermolecular reaction products in each case.
